items: Flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain (450g)
1 small head green cabbage, cored and shredded
Black or white pepper to taste

steps: In a medium bowl, combine the thinly sliced flank steak with 1 tbsp toasted sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, grated ginger, minced garlic, and black pepper. Toss thoroughly to coat and marinate for 10 minutes at room temperature.
Heat 2 tbsp neutral oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat until shimmering, about 1 minute.
Add the marinated beef in a single layer, searing undisturbed for 2 minutes to develop a caramelized crust.
Flip the beef slices and cook for an additional 1 minute until just cooked through, then transfer to a clean plate.
Reduce heat to medium-high and add the shredded cabbage to the same pan. Stir-fry for 4–5 minutes, until the cabbage is tender-crisp and lightly charred at the edges.
Return the seared beef and any accumulated juices to the pan with the cabbage.
Drizzle the remaining 2 tbsp toasted sesame oil over the stir-fry and toss to combine evenly.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

notes: Avoid overcrowding the pan to ensure proper browning.
Toasting the sesame seeds in a dry pan for 1–2 minutes beforehand enhances their nutty aroma.

recipe_info.title: Beef and cabbage stir-fry with sesame
recipe_info.intro: A quick beef stir-fry for a weeknight meal.
